Sentencas: Both a stoichiometric and a nominally A-site deficient chromite anode material showed promising performance at 860 degrees C approaching the ones of state-of-the-art Ni/Gd-doped ceria (CGO) anodes.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: While the difference in polarization resistance was small, an increased ohmic resistance of the perovskite anodes was observed, which is related to their limited electronic conductivity.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Increasing the chromite electrode thickness was shown to enhance performance and stability considerably.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Degradation increased with current density, suggesting its dependency on the electrode potential, and could be reversed by redox cycling.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Sulfur poisoning with 20 ppm hydrogen sulfide led to rapid voltage drops for the chromite anodes.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It is discussed that Ni nanoparticle exsolution facilitates hydrogen dissociation to the extent that it is not rate-limiting at the investigated temperature unless an insufficiently thick electrode thickness is employed or sulfur impurities are present in the feed gas.
Titulo: Performance and Limitations of Nickel-Doped Chromite Anodes in Electrolyte-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
